entry.content:

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Apache2 WebDAV æ¶æ„ .url å¿«æ·æ–¹å¼æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š æ­¤æ¼æ´åˆ©ç”¨Apache2é…ç½®çš„WebDAVæœåŠ¡å™¨å’Œæ¶æ„.urlå¿«æ·æ–¹å¼æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œå¯èƒ½è¢«ç”¨äºé’“é±¼ã€çº¢é˜Ÿæ¼”ç»ƒæˆ–æ¨ªå‘ç§»åŠ¨æ¨¡æ‹Ÿã€‚é€šè¿‡ç‰¹å®šçš„é…ç½®ï¼Œç‚¹å‡»æ¶æ„.urlæ–‡ä»¶å¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´ç›®æ ‡ç³»ç»Ÿè‡ªåŠ¨è¿æ¥åˆ°æ”»å‡»è€…çš„WebDAVæœåŠ¡å™¨ï¼Œä»è€Œå¯èƒ½æ‰§è¡Œæœªæˆæƒçš„å‘½ä»¤æˆ–äº¤ä»˜æ¶æ„è´Ÿè½½ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Apache

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Apache2

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/DevBuiHieu/CVE-2025-33053-Proof-Of-Concept

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • LICENSE
  • README.md
  • gen_url.py
  • setup_webdav.sh

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-33053 Proof Of Concept

This repository provides scripts to automatically deploy a WebDAV server on Ubuntu using Apache2, and generate malicious .url shortcut files for use in phishing, red teaming, or lateral movement simulation.

ğŸ“ Contents

  • setup_webdav.sh â€“ Bash script to configure Apache2 + WebDAV with authentication.
  • setup_webdav.py â€“ Python version of the above.
  • gen_url.py â€“ Python script to generate .url shortcut files with UNC/WebDAV paths.
  • README.md â€“ Documentation.

ğŸ”§ Requirements

  • OS: Ubuntu 20.04 or newer (Debian-compatible)
  • Root privileges (sudo)
  • Python 3.x

ğŸš€ Setup Instructions

1. WebDAV Server (via Bash)

Or using Python:

By default, the script will:

  • Install Apache and required WebDAV modules.
  • Create a shared directory at /var/www/html/webdav.
  • Enable DAV and DAV_FS modules.
  • Configure an Apache virtual host with authentication:
    • Username: webdavuser
    • Password: Web@123
  • Create a DavLockDB directory (to prevent Apache DAV locking errors).
  • Restart the Apache service.

ğŸ“ WebDAV path: http://<your-ip>/webdav/

ğŸ’£ Generating a Malicious .url Shortcut

Example usage:

All Options:

This will create a .url file like:

ğŸ“Œ Clicking this file (in certain configurations) may cause the target system to auto-connect to your WebDAV server (authentication or DLL delivery).

ğŸ”’ Notes for Security Testing

  • Disable Firewall (or open port 80) if testing on a local network:
  • .url files may not execute as expected depending on:
    • Group Policy restrictions
    • Application defaults
    • Email client (Gmail may sanitize them)
  • You may need to zip or rename .url to .txt to bypass filters.

âš ï¸ Legal Disclaimer

This repository is for educational and authorized penetration testing only.
Do not use these scripts against systems you do not own or have permission to test.

ğŸ§  References

  • WebDAV Server Setup - LinuxConfig.org
  • WebDAV Apache Config - Peter Girnus
  • Microsoft WebDAV Docs

ğŸ“¬ Contact

For questions or ethical red teaming requests, reach out via GitHub issues.

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Oracle Coherenceæ˜¯Oracle Fusion Middlewareçš„ä¸€éƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œå—å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬åŒ…æ‹¬3.7.1.0ã€12.1.3.0.0ã€12.2.1.3.0å’Œ12.2.1.4.0ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´å…è®¸æœªç»èº«ä»½éªŒè¯çš„æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡ç½‘ç»œè®¿é—®T3åè®®æ‰§è¡Œè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç ï¼Œä»è€Œå®Œå…¨æ§åˆ¶å—å½±å“çš„ç³»ç»Ÿã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Oracle

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Oracle Coherence

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 3.7.1.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š http.title:â€oracle access managementâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12318

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Oracle Coherence of Oracle Fusion Middleware (versions 3.7.1.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0) contains a remote code execution caused by unauthenticated network access via T3, letting attackers compromise Oracle Coherence, exploit requires network access via T3.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/157054/Oracle-Coherence-Fusion-Middleware-Remote-Code-Execution.html
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/157207/Oracle-WebLogic-Server-12.2.1.4.0-Remote-Code-Execution.html
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/157795/WebLogic-Server-Deserialization-Remote-Code-Execution.html
  • https://github.com/Qynklee/POC_CVE-2020-2555
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/1003dc67ff34
  • https///github.com:Qynklee/POC_CVE-2020-2555.git
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/6179b4e1d51c
  • https///github.com:Y4er/WebLogic-Shiro-shell.git
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/235a5c344d3f
  • https///gitee.com:chenjiew/CVE-2020-2555.git
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/322326255843
  • https///gitee.com:mstir/CVE-2020-2555.git
  • https://github.com/Maskhe/cve-2020-2555
  • https://github.com/Y4er/CVE-2020-2555
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/2c95cddac1b5
  • https///github.com:Y4er/CVE-2020-2555.git
  • https://github.com/wsfengfan/CVE-2020-2555
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/e667362e551e
  • https///github.com:wsfengfan/CVE-2020-2555.git
  • https://github.com/Hu3sky/CVE-2020-2555
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/c9e0223955e2
  • https///github.com:0xn0ne/weblogicScanner.git

KEV: True

Shodan Query: http.title:"oracle access management"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.
